incidents.name: Missing "Additional Logs" for OWASP managed rules WAF events

incident_updates.body: The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Firewall

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare is investigating issues where customers may experience missing additional information in logs in Security Events. This specifically impacts certain requests that trigger the OWASP Core Managed Ruleset.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Firewall

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Stream

incident_updates.body: The team has identified a contributing issue between caching and storage retrieval. An improvement has been released and is being monitored. Additionally, we have adjusted player retry logic to reduce potential stalling. We are continuing our investigation.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Stream

incident_updates.body: The team has identified a contributing issue between caching and storage retrieval. A fix has been released and we will be monitoring for improvements while continuing our investigation.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Stream

incident_updates.body: We are currently investigating reports of intermittent errors impacting Stream on-demand video playback.

components.name: Stream
components.description: Cloudflare Stream lets you or your end users upload, store, encode, and deliver live and on-demand video with one API, without configuring or maintaining infrastructure

incidents.name: Cloudflare Access experiencing elevated login failures from OneLogin

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Access

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare Engineering has confirmed the login failures are coming from OneLogin. The OneLogin team has been notified and is investigating.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Access

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Access when logging in with OneLogin.

All other identity providers and Access services are working as expected.

incident_updates.body:

Existing workers are not affected. We will provide more information shortly.

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare was investigating network performance issues in Brussels.

The impact started at 11:48 UTC and ended at 12:18 UTC.
The cause of this issue was identified and an effective fix was implemented. This incident is now resolved.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Magic WAN
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Network

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare is investigating issues with Network Availability. Magic WAN Customers with no authorized prefixes could face provisioning issues.

We are working to analyze and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

Cloudflare Sites and Services - Network

components.name: Magic WAN
components.description: Magic WAN replaces legacy WAN architectures with Cloudflare’s network, providing global connectivity, cloud-based security, performance, and control through one simple user interface.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Gateway
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Zero Trust

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare has identified issues with the Gateway HTTP policies. Customer is unable to save a HTTP policy when using Application selector and selecting full application categories.

We are working on a fix to resolve this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Gateway
Cloudflare Sites and Services - Zero Trust

components.name: Gateway
components.description: Cloudflare’s secure web gateway keeps your data safe from malware, ransomware, phishing, command & control, Shadow IT, and other Internet risks over all ports and protocols. Log every user interaction with rich details.

incident_updates.body: A code release rolling out across Cloudflare's network increased frequency of Durable Objects timeouts between approximately 2025-06-20 23:45 UTC to 2025-06-21 05:30 UTC. The code release was reverted and investigation is ongoing for the root cause. Products such as R2 and Queues which rely on Durable Objects were impacted.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - API

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare is investigating issues with auto SSL/TLS configuration endpoints returning errors.

These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.

Customers using the Dashboard / Cloudflare APIs are impacted as requests might fail and/or errors may be displayed.

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare engineering is working on reverting the affected signing keys. We do not advise updating keys if you are impacted.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Access

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare engineering is investigating an issue causing authentication to fail for some Access for SaaS applications. This is due to an incorrect certificate signing key. The engineering team is investigating a solution to revert to the original keys. 

Access self-hosted and private network application authentication is not impacted at this time.

components.name: RealtimeKit
components.description:
Build real-time serverless video, audio and data applications.

Cloudflare Realtime is infrastructure for real-time audio/video/data applications. It allows you to build real-time apps without worrying about scaling or regions. It can act as a selective forwarding unit (WebRTC SFU), as a fanout delivery system for broadcasting (WebRTC CDN) or anything in between.

incident_updates.body:
We are currently investigating an issue affecting the Snippets dashboard preview. When attempting to view or edit a Snippet, users may encounter error messages in the UI.

This issue is isolated to the dashboard preview and does not impact existing Snippets functionality at the edge or the ability to deploy new Snippets rules or code. Snippets continue to run normally for end users.

We are working to resolve the dashboard error and restore preview functionality as quickly as possible.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Snippets

components.name: Snippets
components.description: Cloudflare Snippets provide a flexible way to customize the behavior of your website or application using short pieces of JavaScript code. Use snippets to customize HTTP response headers, implement JWT validation, define complex redirect functionality, and more.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare services are recovering quickly around the globe. WARP and Turnstile are operational, though a small residual impact remains and we’re working to eliminate it. The core KV service is restored, bringing dependent products back online. We expect further recovery over the next few minutes and a steady drop in impact.

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare’s critical Workers KV service went offline due to an outage of a 3rd party service that is a key dependency. As a result, certain Cloudflare products that rely on KV service to store and disseminate information are unavailable including:

Access
WARP
Browser Isolation
Browser Rendering
Durable Objects (SQLite backed Durable Objects only)
Workers KV
Realtime
Workers AI
Stream
Parts of the Cloudflare dashboard
Turnstile
AI Gateway
AutoRAG

Cloudflare engineers are working to restore services immediately. We are aware of the deep impact this outage has caused and are working with all hands on deck to restore all services as quickly as possible.

incident_updates.body: We are starting to see services recover. We still expect to see intermittent errors across the impacted services as systems handle retried and caches are filled.

components.name: Access
components.description: Cloudflare Access determines who can reach your application by applying the Access policies you configure

components.name: Dashboard
components.description: Dashboard where customers can view and make changes to their configurations at https://dash.cloudflare.com

components.name: Durable Objects
components.description: Durable Objects provide low-latency coordination and consistent permanent storage for the Workers platform.

components.name: Realtime SFU
components.description: Cloudflare Realtime is infrastructure for real-time audio/video/data applications. It allows you to build real-time apps without worrying about scaling or regions. It can act as a selective forwarding unit (WebRTC SFU), as a fanout delivery system for broadcasting (WebRTC CDN) or anything in between.

components.name: Realtime TURN Service
components.description:
Separately from the SFU, Realtime offers a managed TURN service. TURN acts as a relay point for traffic between WebRTC clients like the browser and SFUs, particularly in scenarios where direct communication is obstructed by NATs or firewalls. TURN maintains an allocation of public IP addresses and ports for each session, ensuring connectivity even in restrictive network environments.

Using Cloudflare Realtime TURN service is available free of charge when used together with the Realtime SFU. Otherwise, it costs $0.05/real-time GB outbound from Cloudflare to the TURN client.

components.name: RealtimeKit
components.description:
Build real-time serverless video, audio and data applications.

Cloudflare Realtime is infrastructure for real-time audio/video/data applications. It allows you to build real-time apps without worrying about scaling or regions. It can act as a selective forwarding unit (WebRTC SFU), as a fanout delivery system for broadcasting (WebRTC CDN) or anything in between.

components.name: Stream
components.description: Cloudflare Stream lets you or your end users upload, store, encode, and deliver live and on-demand video with one API, without configuring or maintaining infrastructure

components.name: Waiting Room
components.description: Cloudflare Waiting Room protects websites by queueing site visitors when a website experiences unmanageable surges in legitimate traffic that may otherwise bring an application down.

components.name: Workers AI
components.description: Workers AI allows you to run machine learning models, on the Cloudflare network, from your own code – whether that be from Workers, Pages, or anywhere via REST API.

components.name: Workers KV
components.description: Workers KV is a data storage that allows you to store and retrieve data globally to build dynamic and performant APIs and websites that support high read volumes with low latency

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Snippets

incident_updates.body:
We’ve identified an issue where newly deployed Snippets may not execute correctly at the edge. In some cases, this can result in exceptions being served to end users.

Snippets that were deployed prior to this incident continue to function normally, and there is no impact to the control plane, dashboard, or API.

We are actively investigating and working on a fix. As a temporary precaution, we recommend postponing critical production changes involving new Snippet deployments.

We will provide updates as soon as more information becomes available.
